content: Is there a way to add narrative to the Artifact Tab? I would like to explain to my reader how to understand this huge page of stuff.

My intention is to put a page in the 'guidance' IG that explains how to read all of the different tabs and parts of a standard template IG and then have the template include a link to the relevant section of that page. If you want to take an initial stab, feel free...

Likely a good idea... but much bigger than I was hoping I needed to do. I was mostly looking to just add narrative that says... "Don't start here, the context and use of each artifact is best discovered reading the narrative of the IG.

The Artifact Index good for the advanced user. But I have had too many novice go in there and get confused. Especially regarding finding structure definitions that are in the IG as they are part of pattern creation. meaning they have no intended use, except for modeling.

If you have a 'Home' page on your menu tab, that's usually what most people would click if they first hit a detail page and are confused. Having text on every page that says "don't start here" would get pretty annoying I'd think...
not disagreeing.. just the artifact index has been a problem

Reviewer used Artifact Index to find an example instance, and could not figure out what it was an example of. This because the examples do not show breadcrumbs back to the structureDefinition, (short-term solution is to add exhaustive replicated instructions in ALL examples.
Note that some examples won't be linked to a particular profile
this would be in the ig base template
Artifact table is indeed confusing.l and unwieldy We are we that? I strongly prefer independent pages for each type as I did ore templates
